subject: Programming
title: Recursion and Its Pitfalls
description: A 60-second lesson on Recursion and Its Pitfalls.

hook.text: To understand recursion, you must first understand recursion.

buildup.text: Recursive algorithms call themselves with a smaller input until reaching a base case.

discovery.text: Merge sort, tree traversals, and fractals all use recursion to express complex logic simply.

twist.text: Each recursive call uses memory. Too many calls without a base case crash the program.

climax.text: Stack overflows are the classic recursion bug â€” the function calls itself until memory runs out.

punchline.text: Every recursion needs a way to stop.
